Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student might draw a simple plant shape without specifics about leaf or stem health.
The student may draw a plant with colors, although not accurately reflecting the plant's health (e.g., might color all leaves green regardless of plant condition).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to accurately depict differences between plants with and without water (e.g., all plants look the same) *(student doesn’t know this)*.
The student might not show or understand the need for sunlight in plant health (e.g., no sunlight depicted or unconnected to plant growth) *(student doesn’t know the role of sunlight)*.
Labeling or captions explaining how water affects plant growth will likely be missing or incorrect *(student doesn’t understand cause and effect relationship)*.
The student might not visibly distinguish between watered and unwatered areas in their drawing (e.g., no dry vs. wet area differentiation) *(misunderstands visual cues for dry and wet)*.
